citation.article-title: Silvimonas iriomotensis sp. nov. and Silvimonas amylolytica sp. nov., new members of the class Betaproteobacteria isolated from the subtropical zone in Japan
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Silvimonas iriomotensis sp. nov.
Silvimonas iriomotensis (i.ri.o.mo.ten′sis. N.L. fem. adj. iriomotensis pertaining to Iriomote Island, Okinawa, Japan, the origin of the soil from which the type strain was isolated).
Cells are Gram-stain-negative, facultatively anaerobic, motile rods that are 1.0–1.5 μm long and 0.3–0.5 μm wide.
Growth is detected at 5–40 °C with an optimum at 30 °C.
pH range for growth is 4–9 with an optimum at pH 4.0.
Tolerates 0–3 % NaCl with optimum growth at 0 %.
Oxidase and catalase activities are positive.
Alginic acid, casein, aesculin, starch, Tween 80 and tyrosine are degraded, but agar, cellulose, chitin, gelatin, inulin, CM-cellulose, DNA and yeast cells are not.
Nitrate is reduced to nitrite but not reduced to gas.
Ammonium sulfate is used as a sole nitrogen source for growth, but sodium nitrate and urea are not.
Can metabolize lactulose, l-asparagine, l-aspartic acid, thymidine, and glucose 1-phosphate as sole carbon source (Biolog GN2 microplate), but not l-rhamnose, d-glucosaminic acid or d,l-lactic acid.
Major fatty acids are C14 : 0, C16 : 0, C16 : 1ω7c and C18 : 1ω7c.
DNA G+C content of the type strain is 59.9 %.
The type strain, ir6-1T (=NBRC 103188T =CGMCC 1.8859T =KCTC 22513T), was isolated from soil of the rhizosphere of bamboos collected in Iriomote Island, Japan, in 2006.
